user.rawDescription: Husband & dad. Mayor. Past Chair of Ontario Big City Mayors. Love Guelph, garage sales, thrifting, vinyl & drums. Email: mayor@guelph.ca for city stuff.

quotedTweet.rawContent:
I’ve just arrived home from being out of country for work the last four days. Yesterday, from afar, I saw people protesting at City Hall and across Canada. Some on both sides of this charged discussion reached out to me prior to these protests wanting me to speak up before the protests even began. I refused because I firmly and unequivocally believe in what our Canadian Charter allows when it comes to the right to freedom of thought, belief and expression. I stand by my decision. Although city staff and media reports confirmed there was no violence, and the protests were peaceful in our city, I did have a chance to now read, see and reflect on some of the commentary and actions taken at the protests that compel me now as mayor to speak up. Discrimination and bullying tactics against ANYONE is not welcome - ANYWHERE. We are a city that won’t and shouldn’t tolerate it. ALL are welcome and ALL should be accepted no matter who they are, how they identify or what they believe. Let us choose kindness and choose to love others. Let us express that love and kindness through our words and actions. It’ll make each of us a better human being and in turn create an even better city! 
We can do it #Guelph!
